intro: Sida mucronulata, commonly known as the small-lobed sida, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, palmate leaves and clusters of tiny, pink or white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Sida mucronulata is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it a valuable plant in ecological restoration efforts.
